entries.translated: Cung cấp snippets, làm nổi cú pháp, khớp ngoặc and gập code cho C# files

entries.original: [EN] Provides syntax highlighting and bracket matching for CSS, LESS and SCSS files.
entries.translated: Cung cấp làm nổi cú pháp and khớp ngoặc cho CSS, LESS and SCSS files

entries.original: [EN] Provides rich language support for CSS, LESS and SCSS files.
entries.translated: Cung cấp rich language support cho CSS, LESS and SCSS files

entries.original: [EN] Helper for auto-attach feature when node-debug extensions are not active.
entries.translated: Helper for auto-attach feature when node-debug extensions are not active.

entries.original: [EN] Open URI in browser if server under debugging is ready.
entries.translated: Open URI in browser if server under debugging is ready.

entries.original: [EN] Act upon a URI when a server program under debugging is ready (indicated by sending output of the form 'listening on port 3000' or 'Now listening on: https://localhost:5001' to the debug console.)
entries.translated: Act upon a URI when a server program under debugging is ready (indicated by sending output of the form 'listening on port 3000' or 'Now listening on: https://localhost:5001' to the debug console.)

entries.original: [EN] What to do with the URI when the server is ready.
entries.translated: What to do with the URI when the server is ready.

entries.original: [EN] Open URI externally with the default application.
entries.translated: Open URI externally with the default application.

entries.original: [EN] Start debugging with the 'Debugger for Chrome'.
entries.translated: Start debugging with the 'Debugger for Chrome'.

entries.original: [EN] Run another launch configuration.
entries.translated: Run another launch configuration.

entries.original: [EN] Server is ready if this pattern appears on the debug console. The first capture group must include a URI or a port number.
entries.translated: Server is ready if this pattern appears on the debug console. The first capture group must include a URI or a port number.

entries.original: [EN] The debug configuration to run.
entries.translated: The debug configuration to run.

entries.original: [EN] A format string used when constructing the URI from a port number. The first '%s' is substituted with the port number.
entries.translated: A format string used when constructing the URI from a port number. The first '%s' is substituted with the port number.

entries.original: [EN] Value passed to the debug configuration for the 'Debugger for Chrome'.
entries.translated: Value passed to the debug configuration for the 'Debugger for Chrome'.

entries.original: [EN] Stop the child session when the parent session stopped.
[EN] Name of the launch configuration to run.

[EN] GitHub features for VS Code
[EN] GitHub Authentication Provider
[EN] GHE.com & GitHub Enterprise Server Authentication

[EN] The URI for your GHE.com or GitHub Enterprise Server instance.

Examples:
* GHE.com: `https://octocat.ghe.com`
* GitHub Enterprise Server: `https://github.octocat.com`

> **Note:** This should _not_ be set to a GitHub.com URI. If your account exists on GitHub.com or is a GitHub Enterprise Managed User, you do not need any additional configuration and can simply log in to GitHub.

[EN] When true, uses Electron's built-in fetch function for HTTP requests. When false, uses the Node.js global fetch function. This setting only applies when running in the Electron environment. **Note:** A restart is required for this setting to take effect.

[EN] When true, prioritize the device code flow for authentication instead of other available flows. This is useful for environments like WSL where the local server or URL handler flows may not work as expected.

[EN] Controls how links to other Markdown files in the Markdown preview should be opened.
[EN] Controls where links in Markdown files should be opened.
[EN] Enable path suggestions while writing links in Markdown files.
[EN] Enable all error reporting in Markdown files.
[EN] Validate reference links in Markdown files, for example: `[link][ref]`. Requires enabling `#markdown.validate.enabled#`.
[EN] Validate fragment links to headers in the current Markdown file, for example: `[link](#header)`. Requires enabling `#markdown.validate.enabled#`.
[EN] Validate links to other files in Markdown files, for example `[link](/path/to/file.md)`. This checks that the target files exists. Requires enabling `#markdown.validate.enabled#`.

[EN] Validate the fragment part of links to headers in other files in Markdown files, for example: `[link](/path/to/file.md#header)`. Inherits the setting value from `#markdown.validate.fragmentLinks.enabled#` by default.

[EN] Configure links that should not be validated. For example adding `/about` would not validate the link `[about](/about)`, while the glob `/assets/**/*.svg` would let you skip validation for any link to `.svg` files under the `assets` directory.
[EN] Validate link definitions that are unused in the current file.
[EN] Validate duplicated definitions in the current file.
[EN] Adds math support to Markdown in notebooks.
[EN] Highlighting and commands for inline merge conflicts.
[EN] Adds Mermaid diagram support to built-in chats.
[EN] Enable a tool for experimental Mermaid diagram rendering in chat responses.

[EN] The tsconfig file that defines the TS build.
[EN] Get started with JavaScript and Node.js
[EN] Make the most of Visual Studio Code's first-class JavaScript experience.
[EN] Install Node.js

[EN] Node.js is an easy way to run JavaScript code. You can use it to quickly build command-line apps and servers. It also comes with npm, a package manager which makes reusing and sharing JavaScript code easy.
[Install Node.js](https://nodejs.org/en/download/)
[EN] Install Node.js

[EN] Node.js is an easy way to run JavaScript code. You can use it to quickly build command-line apps and servers. It also comes with npm, a package manager which makes reusing and sharing JavaScript code easy.
[Install Node.js](https://nodejs.org/en/download/package-manager/)
[EN] Create a JavaScript File

[EN] Let's write our first JavaScript file. We'll have to create a new file and save it with the ``.js`` extension at the end of the file name.
[Create a JavaScript File](command:javascript-walkthrough.commands.createJsFile)
[EN] Run and Debug your JavaScript

[EN] Once you've installed Node.js, you can run JavaScript programs at a terminal by entering ``node your-file-name.js``
Another easy way to run Node.js programs is by using VS Code's debugger which lets you run your code, pause at different points, and help you understand what's going on step-by-step.
[Start Debugging](command:javascript-walkthrough.commands.debugJsFile)
[EN] Explore More

[EN] Want to get more comfortable with JavaScript, Node.js, and VS Code? Be sure to check out our docs!
We've got lots of resources for learning [JavaScript](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/nodejs/working-with-javascript) and [Node.js](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/nodejs/nodejs-tutorial).

[Learn More](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/nodejs/nodejs-tutorial)
